CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant owns a flat in GPE , GPE . In DATE ORG passed a law governing the temporary use of property of persons who had left GPE - Temporary Takeover and ORG o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanju određenom imovinom - hereinafter the “ Property Takeover Act ” ) , which allowed municipalities to temporarily accommodate other persons in such property .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE NORP , a policeman , forcibly moved into the applicant ’s flat in GPE , GPE . On DATE ORG granted him refugee status and legalised his occupation of the applicant ’s flat . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG for repossession of her property .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings before ORG seeking NORP ’s eviction . On DATE the claim was declared inadmissible for lack of jurisdiction . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a request with ORG , Reconstruction and Construction seeking annulment of the decision authorising NORP to occupy her flat .
CARDINAL . The judgment of ORG of DATE was quashed by ORG on DATE and the case was remitted to ORG for a fresh trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the LAW to LAW ( Zakon o izmjenama i dopunama PERSON o područjima od posebne državne skrbi – “ the DATE Amendments ” ) entered into force . They transferred the jurisdiction in the matter from the housing commissions ( which were abolished ) to ORG , Reconstruction and Construction ( ORG radove , obnovu i graditeljstvo – “ the Ministry ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the claim and ordered NORP ’s eviction . NORP appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ministry set aside ORG decision authorising NORP to occupy the applicant ’s flat but also stated that NORP had the right to housing under LAW .

CARDINAL . The judgment of ORG of DATE was quashed by ORG on DATE on the ground that no alternative accommodation had been provided to NORP Accordingly , the case was returned to ORG for further examination . On DATE the applicant lodged an application with ORG complaining about the length of the proceedings . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG instructed ORG to speed up the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again granted the applicant ’s claim and ordered NORP ’s eviction . NORP appealed against this judgment to ORG . While the case was pending there the applicant once more applied to ORG complaining about the length of the proceedings . In a letter of DATE ORG instructed ORG to speed up the proceedings and adopt a judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again quashed the judgment of ORG and accordingly the latter was once more required to examine the applicant ’s claims . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG , as in its previous judgments , found in favour of the applicant . NORP appealed against this judgment and the appeal is at present pending before ORG .
CARDINAL . The following are the relevant sections of LAW ( Zakon o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanju određenom imovinom , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL):-
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) transferred the property belonging to persons who had left GPE after DATE to the care and control of the ORG .

Section CARDINAL , inter alia , authorised the property takeover commissions to allow temporary occupation of property under section CARDINAL by refugees , displaced persons or persons whose property had been destroyed in the war .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Programme for Return ( Program povratka i zbrinjavanja prognanika , izbjeglica i raseljenih osoba , Official Gazette no . GPE ) provided as follows :

“ Persons with NORP [ citizenship ] documents who are owners of property in GPE in which other persons are temporarily accommodated may apply to the municipal housing commission seeking repossession of their property . The commission shall inform the owner within DATE about the status of his property . Relying on proof of ownership , the commission shall set aside any previous decision allowing the temporary accommodation of other persons and order the temporary occupier to vacate the LOC . The commission shall serve a written decision on the owner and on the temporary occupier within DATE . The decision shall contain a time - limit for eviction and an offer of alternative accommodation for the temporary occupier in a house or flat under state ownership .

If a temporary occupier fails to vacate the LOC within the fixed time - limit , the commission shall institute eviction proceedings in the competent municipal court within DATE . The court shall apply the provisions concerning summary procedure in civil matters . The court ’s decision shall be immediately enforceable . An appeal shall not interfere with the enforcement proceedings or the repossession of the property by the owner . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Zakon o prestanku važenja PERSON o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanu određenom imovinom , Official PERSON no . DATE ) provided that the Programme for Return applied to proceedings concerning the temporary use , management and control of the property of persons who had left GPE and that such proceedings were to be conducted by housing commissions in the first instance and by municipal courts in the second instance . They were required to apply LAW .

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL , DATE and QUANTITY on Areas of Special State Concern ( Zakon o područjima od posebne državne skrbi , ORG nos . CARDINAL , ORG ( errata ) , DATE , CARDINAL , QUANTITY ( errata ) , PERSON , PERSON , CARDINAL , CARDINAL ( consolidated text ) , DATE ) , as amended by LAW , gave a temporary occupier a right to housing .

Section CARDINAL ( enacted on DATE , published in the Official Gazette no . CARDINAL of DATE , came into force on DATE ) obliges the Ministry to secure alternative accommodation for the occupier within DATE of the owner ’s request for the return of his or her property , failing which the owner is entitled to seek the conclusion of a lease agreement by which the occupier leases the LOC and ORG pays the rent to the owner .

Section CARDINAL obliges the Ministry to pay compensation for the damage sustained by an owner who applied for repossession of his or her property prior to DATE but to whom the property was not returned by DATE .

CARDINAL . The Decision on the Level of Compensation Due to Owners for Damage Sustained ( ORG o visini naknade vlasnicima za pretrpljenu štetu , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) establishes the amount of that compensation at CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) per square metre .
CARDINAL . The following are the relevant sections of LAW ( Zakon o vlasništvu i drugim stvarnim pravima , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) entitles the owner of property to recover it from anyone who is in possession of it .
Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) allows anyone entitled to retain possession ( that is , if he or she has a right of possession ) to refuse to return the property to its owner .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW ( Zakon o sudovima , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE , entered into force on DATE ) reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) In the determination of his rights and obligations or of a criminal charge against him or her , everyone is entitled to a fair hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial tribunal established by law .

“ ( CARDINAL ) A party to the judicial proceedings ... may lodge a request for the protection of the right to a hearing within a reasonable time with a court hierarchically superior [ to the one conducting the proceedings ] .

“ ( CARDINAL ) Where the court deciding a request under LAW finds it founded it shall set a time - limit within which the competent court must decide the case on the merits ... and shall also assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her right to a hearing within a reasonable time .

( CARDINAL ) An appeal lies to ORG against a decision on a request for protection of the right to a hearing within a reasonable time . ... a constitutional complaint may be lodged against ORG decision . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE – “ LAW ” ) reads as follows :
Section CARDINAL

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the competent court fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant ’s rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the competent court must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date on which a request for payment is lodged . ”

CARDINAL . NORP In a series of decisions ( for example , in cases nos . Rev-CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE , CARDINAL of DATE and CARDINAL of DATE ) , starting with decision no . RevCARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE ORG interpreted the relationship between LAW and LAW as follows :

“ The jurisdiction to decide on an owner ’s application for repossession conferred on the administrative authorities LAW does not exclude ordinary court jurisdiction in such matters under LAW . Therefore , a civil action for repossession , based on section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW and brought in a court against a temporary occupier by an owner whose property had been taken over under LAW , should be decided on its merits rather than declared inadmissible for lack of jurisdiction . ”
CARDINAL . In its decisions ORG . LAW and RevCARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE ORG gave a further interpretation of the relationship between LAW and LAW as well as of ORG :

“ The temporary occupier ’s right to use the owner ’s property does not cease merely for the reason that a housing commission has set aside the decision allowing him or her to do so . This is because the duty to return the property to its owner is conditional upon the duty of the ORG to provide alternative accommodation for the temporary occupier .

It follows that the temporary occupier is not obliged to compensate the owner for the use of his or her property since , before being provided with alternative accommodation , he or she remains in bona fide possession . ”
